page.title: 18 THE MUSEUM IN CASTLE CARY
page.content: CASTLE CARY MUSEUM IS IN THE HIGH STREET . IT IS SITUATED IN THE MIDDLE OF THE TOWN. IT IS OPEN FROM APRIL TO OCTOBER (10.00 AM TO 12 NOON AND 2.30 TO 4.30 PM) AND ADMISSION IS FREE. IT IS A VERY INTERESTING BUILDING. IN THE TOP ROOM THERE ARE FARMING TOOLS SUCH AS TRAPS, BREAST PLOUGHS AND A COMMON SCYTHE. OPPOSITE THAT THERE IS A COLLECTION OF BOTTLES. SOME OF THEM ARE MEDICINE BOTTLES AND INK BOTTLES. THERE ARE ALSO SOME CHINA WATER AND ALE BOTTLES. THE NEXT ROOM CONTAINS OLD PHOTOGRAPHS AND SOME OLD CLOTHES. THEN UP STAIRS WERE SOME FOSSILS AND OLD COINS AND SOME CHINA. THERE ARE ALSO SOME OLD RADIOS AND RECORD PLAYERS.ON THE WALLS ARE OLD POSTERS AND PICTURES. IN THE ROOM BELOW THERE IS AN OLD MEAT MARKET SET OUT AS IN THE OLD DAYS.
